title.narrative: 1.4.IMPROVED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE/BEHAVIOUR

description.narrative: 1.4 Households have improved knowledge and practice of essential child health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) behaviours in selected districts of the country, which contributes to Child Health, Health â€“ General, Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable access to and utilization of quality, high impact mother and child health and HIV interventions results in reduced child mortality and morbidity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4 Households have improved knowledge and practice of essential child health, nutrition and WASH behaviours in selecteddistricts of the country

description.narrative: The 2017 public health emergencies and outbreaks increased sensitization and awareness of families/populations on key essential family practices: such as hand- washing and general hygiene promotion, uptake of routine immunization, infant and child nutrition, antenatal care etc as part of resilience capacity building. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:07/01/2018
